paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel deletion-frameshift mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome in a Chinese Han family.

patients.demographics: Chinese Han family, including a 47-year-old female proband and her mother

individual_records.phenotype_details: Experienced syncope and had a prolonged QTc interval of 481 ms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (II-6) was a 47 year old Chinese Han female, who was born at full term after an uncomplicated pregnancy and delivery.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Mother of the proband, also had symptoms of syncope.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Her mother also had the symptom of syncope.

functional_data.summary: The mutation results in a frameshift mutation that truncates the protein, losing most of the N-terminus and all transmembrane domains.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation was confirmed in both the proband and her mother, and not found in unaffected family members or 50 unrelated healthy controls.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation and functional impact.
variants.additional_notes: This is a novel mutation not previously reported in the literature.
key_quotes: This novel heterozygous mutation results in a frameshift mutation after the 128th residue (Asparagine), which replaced the original 1031 amino acids with 27 novel amino acids (p.N128fsX156).
No mutation at this site was found in available unaffected family members or in 50 unaffected, unrelated healthy controls.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
